snippet: Many people go through life with a single, vivid taste image of a lemon -- one of something acidic, clean tasting and unforgivingly sharp. Unlike an orange, which can have dozens of flavors, depending on the variety, the lemon has just one reliabl...
lead_paragraph: Many people go through life with a single, vivid taste image of a lemon -- one of something acidic, clean tasting and unforgivingly sharp. Unlike an orange, which can have dozens of flavors, depending on the variety, the lemon has just one reliable note that sticks firmly in their minds. That is, until they taste a Meyer lemon.
abstract: Cooks welcome arrival of Meyer lemons, which have a much more nuanced flavor than the common supermarket varieties; there are still fewer than a dozen commercial growers of Meyer lemons in California, and their groves and packing houses are small and personally run; recipes; photos (M)
